website_summaries.verdict: Produce high-end cafe-quality espresso and delicious coffee in seconds with this powerful, quality grinder.
pros: Machine runs quietly and efficiently with a powerful DC motor
Ceramic burrs ensure no static electricity and no mess on the counter
The Vario model produces a high-quality, wide range of grinds
The built-in scale eliminates the need to measure your beans
cons: Sits at a high price point, almost double the cost of some models

customer_reviews.title: Coffee Snob
customer_reviews.text: Great but expensive coffee grinder. What I liked is that the burrs are replaceable unlike my other $135 grinder that only lasted 1 1/2 years. I like the fact that the grounds are weighed and not dispensed by time. More accurate as the burr wears. If you prefer drip or French Press coffee, be sure to get the steel burrs so that your coffee will be of a coarse enough grind for those applications. The Baratza website and YouTube are a wealth of information. Customer service is top drawer!
customer_reviews.author: apologist

customer_reviews.title: Excellent coffee grinder
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Baratza Vario grinder. After accidentally knocking the first one off the counter I knew the replacement could only be another Baratza. While not inexpensive, the grinder performs beautifully (if not knocked to the floor) for years with consistency. Used daily for French press, pour overs and espresso in our home, this workhorse pays for itself by providing the precision that home coffee enthusiasts demand. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Annie in KC

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder with a weird flaw
customer_reviews.text: The grinder is great in terms of the core grinding, speed, noise, etc. Amazingly good! The weird problem is that the bin that holds the ground coffee is made of a plastic that is super-high-static. That means that the grounds don't all come out and in fact stick to the outside of the bin when pouring. I am mystified by this issue. I 100% see how that is a problem you have in the first run, but how did they not switch plastics after the first run, particularly when their other grinders use different materials for that. Posting this review because they really need to address this implementation flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but nice
customer_reviews.text: Expensive but love the built in scale and automatic amount settings . Use it every day. One thing I noted is that on the coarsest setting it is still a finer grind then I expected. Also stopped working once and after cleaning, resetting, reset again, it worked
customer_reviews.author: Mat T

customer_reviews.title: clean; easy to switch coffee and grind settings
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! My old grinder leaves grounds all over the place. This one captures the grounds nicely in the container. Grind is right on, and the wife and I can grind both our coffee and espresso each morning without hassle.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Quality built
customer_reviews.text: A grinder is the heart of your coffee equipment and this seems to be build to last.
customer_reviews.author: Kim R Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Couldnt be happier with product
customer_reviews.text: Just used it to grind nice beans ..once you figure out exactly how many grams you need for a pot and program a preset ..you touch two buttons and ..voila dump in the filter ..and brew ..no more scooping etc ..very quiet ..much more so than last machine ..and grind consistency and contol is amazing ..youtube for more precise usage guides
customer_reviews.author: Mark A Hall

customer_reviews.title: Good for the first 6 months then died
customer_reviews.text: It worked well for the 6 months it actually worked. I ground an average of 60-120 mg of coffee per day 7 days a week with the unit. I cleaned it at least once a month but this morning while getting coffee ready smoke rolled out of the motor and it was done. I took it apart but couldn't really see anything wrong. I'll look closer at it tonight but I'm not very happy what I consider a low usage machine just burned up.
customer_reviews.author: Den

customer_reviews.title: It seems to be an excellent model. Crazy expensive
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this burr grinder for about two weeks. It seems to be an excellent model. Crazy expensive!
customer_reviews.author: Prime Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT espresso!!
customer_reviews.text: If you are making espresso, this is an amazing grinder! I am new to the process and originally bought a cheap grinder. Could not figure out why I could not pull a decent shot, no pressure, no crema, WHAT was I doing wrong??? I bought a crappy grinder, that's what. Then I bought the Baratza, great crema, great pressure (in fact at first I hit the OPV!) Once dialed in my coffee was easy and delicious. Can't say enough about this grinder!
customer_reviews.author: Sioux

customer_reviews.title: Worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: Grinder works great. Grinds coffee perfectly every time and is much quieter than our old Kitchen Aide grinder. The hopper is easy to clean and refill. I have two complaints. The first is some grounds stay in the shoot and then fall on the scale/kitchen counter and the second is the bind that catches the grinds is not as static free as I would like. Both of the complaints are miner and easily tolerated.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty F.

customer_reviews.title: Clogging - Inferior Parts Need Expensive Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my Baratza Vario-W brand new a little over a year ago. I grind coarse for press. Recently it started clogging after a few seconds of grinding. Yes, I tried completely different beans and cleaning five times per instructions without luck. So I contacted Baratza and it was explained that the plastic "carrier" part must be worn out and needs a metal carrier upgrade for $90 +freight. I was curious and ask if the metal carrier is is now standard on new Vario-W units. No, they are still shipped with the cheap plastic carrier I was told. $550.00 ??? and they still ship the inferior carrier only to need an upgrade later. I am extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: deni

customer_reviews.title: A new high level of Coffee grinder
customer_reviews.text: Have owned a Virtuoso for about 15 years. I decided to upgrade to a flat burr espresso grinder. The Vario W is really a accurate grinder it took about 6 2oz shots to get the Vario w dialed in. Super consistent pulls out of my Ranciliio Silvia. PID Wonderful Grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

product_meta.title: Baratza Vario-W Grind by Weight Flat Burr Coffee Grinder
feature_bullets: SPECIALTY COFFEE ASSOCIATION AWARD WINNING GRINDERS - Baratza grinders are preferred by coffee professionals and backed by Baratza’s world class support.

230 GRIND SETTINGS - For dialing in espresso and all brewing methods (Aeropress, Hario V60, Chemex, French Press, and automatic brewers). Offers exceptional cup quality for home, office or light commercial use.
HIGH PERFORMANCE GRINDING - 54mm professional ceramic flat burrs by Mahlkonig, provide high throughput and maintain sharpness, and a built in scale provides precise dosing.
GRIND BY WEIGHT - Built in digital scale for accurate weight based dosing. Programmable buttons to save up to 3 different presets for a repeatable, one-touch grinding.

WARRANTY/QUALITY PARTS - engineered with 54mm professional ceramic flat burrs by Mahlkonig in Germany, plus a powerful DC motor. This combination creates a consistent grind and durability ensuring the longevity users have come to expect from the Baratza brand. The Vario-W is backed by Baratza’s world class support and a 1 year warranty.
